title: CEOs push back on proposed cuts to commercial satellite imaging programs
summary: CEOs of leading U.S. satellite imaging firms, including Iceye US, urge Congress to reject proposed budget cuts to commercial remote sensing programs, warning that reductions could undermine national security and reverse progress in integrating private-sector innovation into intelligence and defense operations.
why_it_matters: The proposed cuts to commercial satellite imaging programs could impact the growth of the U.S. remote sensing industry and its integration into national security operations, potentially ceding technological leadership to competitors like China.

entities.name: U.S. Chamber of Commerce
entities.role: supporter of commercial remote sensing programs
